page.title: 09Poultry Farming
page.content: Down the lane from the road were black-topped buildings with silver bins by them.Mr Peck who looks after the farm employs 41 part-time workers and 20 full-time.He has 10 sheds,the smallest of which holds 17 000 chickens and the largest 38 000.In all he has 250 000 chickens. The main breed of chickens on the farm is Ross brown,there are also a few Isa brown and Hisex brown.Each chicken lives for 72 weeks.20 weeks are spent growing and 52 weeks are spent laying eggs.When young the chicken lays the small size seven eggs,when in its prime it lays size four eggs and when older it lays the large size one eggs.The eggs produced on Knockin egg farm are mainly brown and rarely white as Ross brown are laying them.
